intro: Cistanche lutea f. minor, commonly known as the lesser yellow苁蓉, is a parasitic plant belonging to the Orobanchaceae family. It lacks chlorophyll and relies entirely on host plants for nutrients, typically growing on species of the genus Euonymus. The plant produces yellow-orange flowers with five petals, and its stems are cylindrical and somewhat woody. It is native to regions of China and is used in traditional medicine for its purported tonic properties. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
